displaytitle: Isis and Horus-Ariesi, Temple of Kalabsha
creditline: Robert O. Dougan Collection, gift of Warner Communications, Inc.
inscribed:
Printed on mount, above image top center: NUBIE.

Printed on mount, below image left and right: Maxime Du Camp / Gide et Baudry, Editeurs.

Printed on mount, below image center: KALABSCHEH. / ISIS ET HORUS-ARSIÉSI. / Imprimerie Photographique de Blanquard-Evrard, à Lille. / Pl. 92.

titles.title: Isis and Horus-Ariesi, Temple of Kalabsha

makers.displaymaker: Printed by Louis Désiré Blanquart-Evrard, French, 1802–1872

makers.displaydate: 1822–1894; born Paris, France; died Baden-Baden, Germany; active France and Egypt
makers.displaymaker: Maxime Du Camp, 1822–1894; born Paris, France; died Baden-Baden, Germany; active France and Egypt

texts.textentryhtml: Du Camp, a photographer and founder of the periodical Revue de Paris, was among the first Europeans to publish travel books illustrating the ancient  onuments of Egypt in the new medium of photography. These images are from his series Egypt, Nubie, Palestine and Syrie, made during travels in the region with the novelist Gustave Flaubert. Emphasizing a foreign culture’s exotic and timeless qualities, Du Camp’s photographs epitomize the Orientalism of the time. At the same time, the temple friezes subvert the Western gaze with scenes of daily life from the perspective of the ancient Egyptians.

bibliography.boilertext: "Acquisitions of the Art Museum 1979," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 39, no. 1/2 (1980): p. 40-63.
bibliography.citation: "Acquisitions of the Art Museum 1979," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 39, no. 1/2 (1980): p. 40-63., p. 58

geography.displaygeography: Place depicted: Africa, Egypt, Philae, Temple of Isis, relocated to Agilkia Island
geography.locale: Temple of Isis, relocated to Agilkia Island
